title: Simple Booking
description: Whether you book a hotel online, on the phone, or through a travel agent, it should be a simple process. It should be easy to contact a knowledgeable, helpful person if you have questions, changes to your initial booking, or special requests. Anything else is a red flag.

title: Fast, Friendly First Contact
description: When you first pull up to a hotel entrance or walk into the lobby, your initial encounter tells you plenty about the type of place you’re staying.

title: A Genuinely Cheerful, Helpful, Knowledgeable Staff
description: There’s a fundamental difference between fake cheerfulness and genuine warmth. Great hotels hire people with intuitive qualities: observant, empathetic, kind, and funny. Harrison describes them as people “who quietly make guests feel comfortable and important.”

title: A Variety of Excellent Food and Drink
description: Even if you’re planning on having most of your meals outside the hotel, a solid reputation for on-site restaurants is a good indicator of a hotel’s overall quality.
